et: Middle English {it}saufgarde{/it}, from Anglo-French, from {it}sauf{/it} safe + {it}garde{/it} guard
shortdef: a precautionary measure, stipulation, or device

pt: {sc}defend{/sc} {sc}protect{/sc} {sc}shield{/sc} {sc}guard{/sc} {sc}safeguard{/sc} mean to keep secure from danger or against attack. {sc}defend{/sc} denotes warding off actual or threatened attack.
{sc}protect{/sc} implies the use of something (such as a covering) as a bar to the admission or impact of what may attack or injure.

pt.t: a hard hat to {it}protect{/it} your head

pt: {sc}shield{/sc} suggests protective intervention in imminent danger or actual attack.

pt.t: {it}shielded{/it} her eyes from the sun with her hand

pt: {sc}guard{/sc} implies protecting with vigilance and force against expected danger.
{sc}safeguard{/sc} implies taking precautionary protective measures against merely possible danger.
